org.fraunhofer.java_mqtt_usability_client.manager

Class DeviceRepresentationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fraunhofer.java_mqtt_usability_client.manager.DeviceRepresentationManager

  • public class DeviceRepresentationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Matthias This class Manages the DeviceRepresentations or HomeyDeviceRepresentations. The DeviceRepresentations can be seen as a representation of a device. To utilise a DeviceRepresentation to it's fullest potential, provide the main topic of a device as the topic for the creation of the DeviceRepresentation followed by "/#" as this will save the newest update of each subtopic in the DeviceRepresentation. These updates can be accesed over the getDeviceValue function of the DeviceRepresentation with the specific topic under which the message was sent

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeviceRepresentationManager()
      create a new DeviceRepresentationManager use this to create new DeviceRepresentations to access the state of devices and send them commands

      add a new DeviceRepresentation to the manager DeviceRepresentations must be given a unique name the client of this DeviceRepresentation will access the broker with the given username and password

    • Method Detail

      • getDeviceRepresentation

        public DeviceRepresentation getDeviceRepresentation(java.lang.String representedDeviceName)
        Parameters:
        representedDeviceName - name of the DeviceRepresentation you wish to access
        Returns:
        returns the specified DeviceRepresentation

      • addDeviceRepresentation

        public void addDeviceRepresentation(java.lang.String representedDeviceName,
                                    java.lang.String broker,
                                    java.lang.String topic)
        add a new DeviceRepresentation to the manager DeviceRepresentations must be given a unique name
        Parameters:
        representedDeviceName - the name that the DeviceRepresentation should assume
        broker - the broker that the DeviceRepresentation should use to communicate
        topic - the topic that the DeviceRepresentation should subscribe to the newest updates that will be sent under the given topic will be saved wildcards are allowed if more that one topic's updates should be saved

      • addDeviceRepresentation

        public void addDeviceRepresentation(java.lang.String representedDeviceName,
                                    java.lang.String broker,
                                    java.lang.String topic,
                                    java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String password)
        add a new DeviceRepresentation to the manager DeviceRepresentations must be given a unique name the client of this DeviceRepresentation will access the broker with the given username and password
        Parameters:
        representedDeviceName - the name that the DeviceRepresentation should assume
        broker - the broker that the DeviceRepresentation should use to communicate
        topic - the topic that the DeviceRepresentation should subscribe to the newest updates that will be sent under the given topic will be saved wildcards are allowed if more that one topic's updates should be saved
        username - the username that will be used to access the broker
        password - the password that will be used to access the broker
